links.description: DESQView, from Quarterdeck, was a DOS application multi-tasker and in later versions functioned as an X client for applications on remote UNIX systems. links.title: BearSSL - Speed Benchmarks
links.description: BearSSL primary optimisation goal is to reduce compiled code size. This does not mean that raw execution speed is unimportant; only that, when faced with a size/speed trade-off, BearSSL tends to put more emphasis on the âsizeâ measure than what most cryptographic libraries do. For instance, the RSA implementation will use generic code that can handle all key sizes, with no specific code for common key sizes (like 2048 bits).

links.title: Self-powered camera sensor combines imaging, energy harvesting
links.description: Using a 0.18Î¼m standard CMOS process, a team of researchers from the University of Michigan have redesigned the pixels of an image sensor so that each pixel can perform as a photodetector while simultaneously operating as a photovoltaic cell for energy harvesting. Such an image sensor could be designed into always-on battery-less cameras or contribute to extending the battery life of camera-enabled IoT devices.

links.title: Reverse engineering

Projects :: OpenCores
Overview :: ao486 :: OpenCores
links.description:
The ao486 is an x86 compatible Verilog core implementing all features of a 486 SX.
The core was modeled and tested based on the Bochs software x86 implementation.
Together with the 486 core, the ao486 project also contains a SoC capable of
booting the Linux kernel version 3.13 and Microsoft Windows 95.

links.title: Overview :: Next 80186 processor :: OpenCores
links.description: 80186 instruction compatible, high performance processor, able to execute up to 40MIPS on a Spartan3AN FPGA. It requires ~1500 slices (25%) on a Spartan3AN. The speed performance is comparable with a 486 in 16bit real mode.

links.title: Overview :: v586 :: OpenCores
links.description:
This project is a soft processor core compatible with 586 instruction set.
The processor core has AXI4 interface and uses XILINX AXI4 IPs such as AXI4 CROSSBAR and MIG with AXI 4 interface.
The platform boots linux kernel with a ramdisk contained in the SPI flash.

The package contains code for NEXYS4 DDR and ESA-11-7a100t-v1.1 boards , with artix7 device inside
external DDR2/3 size 128MB DDR and 128Mbit SPI Flash.

links.title: Reducing an LTO Linux kernel bug with cvise
links.description: My co-maintainer Nick Desaulniers wrote a great post about taking a several thousand line C file that exposed a compiler bug down to 12 lines with creduce. I thought I would do the same thing with a bug that only happens with link time optimization (LTO) in the Linux kernel, which is a bit of a different beast. Hopefully this post can help others reduce their own bugs and think about the best way to triage a bug.
links.original_title: Reducing an LTO Linux kernel bug with cvise
